brief_title: Effect of tissue-specific PPARg deficiency in bacterial loads
description: In this study WT, CD4 cre+ and LysMcre- mice were infected with H. pylori strain SS1 for six months.
endpoints: Stomach samples for reisolation were collected once a week to assess bacterial loads.
hypothesis: The deficiency of PPARg results in a phenotype shift towards a more pro-inflammatory state. Therefore, PPARg deficiency should result in increased inflammation and lead to enhanced bacterial clearance.
objectives: The aim of this study was to assess whether the lack of PPARg in either CD4 T cells or macrophages has any effect of bacterial clearance.
official_title: Effect of tissue-specific PPARg deficiency in bacterial loads
